byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky contributed reporting from London; Simon Romero from Rio de Janeiro; and Merna Thomas from Cairo.

abstract: FIFA Pres Sepp Blatter attempts to deflect responsibility for bribery and corruption scandal involving top officials at organization; has not been charged in United States Justice Department indictment and is expected to easily beat challenger Prince Ali bin al-Hussein of Jordan in upcoming election.
lead_paragraph: The scandal has not changed the strange electoral math of FIFA: Europe’s support of Prince Ali bin al-Hussein is outweighed by the support of many small countries for Blatter.

headline.main: Sepp Blatter Is Unfazed Entering FIFA Election
headline.print_headline: Blatter Is Unfazed on Eve of Election

snippet: The scandal has not changed the strange electoral math of FIFA: Europe’s support of Prince Ali bin al-Hussein is outweighed by the support of many small countries for Blatter.

keywords.value: Ali bin al-Hussein, Prince of Jordan
keywords.name: persons
